abstract: Seth Goldman answers reader questions, like whether he’s sorry he partnered with Coke.
snippet: Seth Goldman answers reader questions, like whether he’s sorry he partnered with Coke.
lead_paragraph: The case study we published last week chronicled the back and forth between Honest Tea and Coca-Cola, its biggest investor. Written by Elizabeth Olson, the piece explained that Coke executives had asked Honest Tea to remove the words “no high fructose corn syrup” from its juice pouches because the executives considered them an implicit rebuke of Coke products that do contain the syrup. “We got a strong request to change the wording,” said Seth Goldman, co-founder of Honest Tea.

headline.main: How Honest Tea Stood Up to Coke
